title: Investigation of the impact of optical glass composition on ceria slurry stability during chemical mechanical polishing process

samples.experiment_context: Original 400 nm ceria particle slurry (Treibacher Industry AG) before polishing process.

particle_size_distribution.aggregation_notes: Initial slight aggregation (D50 ~700nm at 6min post-sonication). Significant sedimentation after 8min, larger aggregates (D50 ~2300nm) after 1 hour.

characterization.particle_morphology: Significant aggregate formation observed in SEM (Fig 9).
characterization.sedimentation_rate: Noticeable sedimentation after 60 min, pronounced after 270 min. Correlates with low zeta potential (Fig 8).

samples.experiment_context: 400 nm ceria particle slurry after polishing soda-lime glass for 8 min.

particle_size_distribution.aggregation_notes: Aggregation observed at 8-12 min (D50 ~1300nm), stabilized around D50 ~600nm after 60 min. Some sedimentation noted (Fig 7c).

characterization.particle_morphology: Mainly dispersed particles with minor aggregation observed in SEM (Fig 9).
characterization.sedimentation_rate: Minimal sedimentation observed over 270 min. Correlates with relatively high zeta potential (Fig 8).

material_removal_rate.calculation_notes: Calculated from total mass removal of 10.8 mg (Fig 2) over 8 min.

post_cmp_surface_roughness.measurement_method_used: Alpha-Step IQ surface profiler (Ra, estimated from Fig 3)

samples.experiment_context: 400 nm ceria particle slurry after polishing borosilicate glass for 8 min.

particle_size_distribution.aggregation_notes: Stable PSD (D50 ~450nm) throughout observation period (up to 1h). Good dispersion noted (Fig 7d).

characterization.particle_morphology: Mainly dispersed particles with minor aggregation observed in SEM (Fig 9).
characterization.sedimentation_rate: Minimal sedimentation observed over 270 min. Correlates with high zeta potential (Fig 8).

material_removal_rate.calculation_notes: Calculated from total mass removal of 4.0 mg (Fig 2) over 8 min.

post_cmp_surface_roughness.measurement_method_used: Alpha-Step IQ surface profiler (Ra, estimated from Fig 3)

samples.experiment_context: 400 nm ceria particle slurry after polishing fused silica glass for 8 min.

particle_size_distribution.aggregation_notes: High aggregation. Bimodal distribution (~650nm and ~1900nm at 6min post-sonication). Average size increased to ~5000nm after 60min. Correlates with near-zero zeta potential (Fig 7b).

characterization.particle_morphology: Significant aggregate formation observed in SEM (Fig 9).
characterization.sedimentation_rate: Noticeable sedimentation after 60 min, pronounced after 270 min. Correlates with low zeta potential (Fig 8).

material_removal_rate.calculation_notes: Calculated from total mass removal of 5.3 mg (Fig 2) over 8 min.

post_cmp_surface_roughness.measurement_method_used: Alpha-Step IQ surface profiler (Ra, estimated from Fig 3)

samples.experiment_context: Original 80 nm ceria particle slurry (commercial, Pieplow & Brandt GmbH) before polishing process.

additives.name: Stabilization agents
additives.details: Mentioned in Sec 3.2a, specific agents not identified.

particle_size_distribution.aggregation_notes: Measured D50 size between 170-220 nm (higher than nominal 80nm due to measurement effects/slight aggregation). Stable PSD observed (Fig 6).

characterization.particle_morphology: Well-dispersed particles with minimal aggregate formation observed in SEM (Fig 9).
characterization.sedimentation_rate: Excellent dispersion, no visible sedimentation over 270 min. Correlates with high zeta potential (Fig 8).

title: Effects of Ceria Abrasive Particle Size Distribution below Wafer Surface on In-Wafer Uniformity during Chemical Mechanical Polishing Processing

samples.experiment_context: Uni-modal ceria slurry (Type A) used to study the effect of particle size distribution under wafer on CMP uniformity. Synthesized using the same technique as other types, size controlled by milling.

slurry_preparation.synthesis_details: Synthesized with the same technique as Types B, C, D; size controlled by milling process time with zirconia balls.

particle_morphology.description: Agglomerated ceria nanoparticles (based on TEM images in Fig 2b for uni-modal type)

observed_distribution_effects.observation: Amount of small size particles significantly reduced at the center compared to edge and original slurry.

Smaller size abrasives were not found at the highest pressure (6 psi). Lower pressure (2 psi) is more effective at keeping small abrasives at the center. Amount of slurry abrasive decreases with increasing pressure.

observed_distribution_effects.condition: Effect of Pad Morphology at Center (Fig 6a)
observed_distribution_effects.observation: Abrasive size below 80 nm not observed in used pad (24h). Reduced amount of smaller abrasives in used pad compared to unused. Pad with small pore size/high density showed little difference between edge and center.
As slurry became more viscous (higher PAA %), smaller abrasive particles were observed and their amount increased. Effect gradual with increased PAA.

equipment_model.polisher: MIRRA, AMAT Co. commercial 8 in. polishing machine

pad_composition.name: Customized Pad
pad_composition.description: Smaller pore diameter and higher pore density than IC1010

material_removal_rate_mrr.notes: Fig 8a shows MRR profiles visually but does not provide specific numerical values for the comparative conditions. Text indicates higher MRR at center than edge under New Pad and 0.5% Additive conditions compared to Conventional.

observed_distribution_effects.observation: Amount of small size particles significantly reduced at the center compared to edge and original slurry.

target_final_slurry_ph.notes: Assumed same as other types based on general description

samples.experiment_context: Bi-modal ceria slurry (Type D) used to study the effect of particle size distribution under wafer on CMP uniformity. Synthesized using the same technique as other types, size controlled by longer milling time.

slurry_preparation.synthesis_details: Synthesized with the same technique as Types A, B, C; size controlled by longer milling process time with zirconia balls compared to uni-modal types.

particle_morphology.description: Agglomerated ceria nanoparticles, bi-modal distribution confirmed (Fig 2b)

observed_distribution_effects.observation: Similar trend to uni-modal (small particles reduced at center), but entire particle count at the center was greatly reduced.

Smaller size abrasives were not found at the highest pressure (6 psi). Lower pressure (2 psi) is more effective at keeping small abrasives at the center. Amount of slurry abrasive decreases with increasing pressure.

observed_distribution_effects.condition: Effect of Pad Morphology at Center (Fig 6b)
observed_distribution_effects.observation: Abrasive size below 80 nm not observed in used pad (24h). Reduced amount of smaller abrasives in used pad compared to unused. Pad with small pore size/high density showed little difference between edge and center.

As slurry became more viscous (higher PAA %), smaller abrasive particles were observed and their amount increased. Significant increase in particle count with addition of PAA. Effect more significant for particles below 100 nm.

equipment_model.polisher: MIRRA, AMAT Co. commercial 8 in. polishing machine

pad_composition.name: Customized Pad
pad_composition.description: Smaller pore diameter and higher pore density than IC1010

material_removal_rate_mrr.notes: Fig 8b shows MRR profiles visually but does not provide specific numerical values for the comparative conditions. Text indicates reduction in MRR at center under Conventional conditions. Uniformity improved (implying center MRR increased relative to edge) under New Pad and 0.5% Additive conditions.

title: Effect of synergistic CeO₂/MoS₂ abrasives on surface roughness and material removal rate of quartz glass

substrate.supplier: Xuzhong Quartz Products Co., Ltd., China

abrasives.name: CeO₂
abrasives.supplier: Zhongye New Materials Co., Ltd., China

characterization.morphology: Irregular spherical nanoparticles with prominent edges and corners (Fig 2a, 2b)

abrasives.name: MoS₂
abrasives.supplier: Shanghai Macklin Biochemical Technology Co., Ltd., China

additives.name: Potassium Oleate (KOL)
additives.supplier: Shanghai Macklin Biochemical Technology Co., Ltd., China

additives.name: NaOH
additives.supplier: Shanghai Macklin Biochemical Technology Co., Ltd., China

materials_and_methods_summary.slurry_preparation_method: Mechanical swirling, followed by 20 min ultrasonic treatment for uniform suspension.

cmp_process.equipment: UNIPOL-802 precision lapping/polishing machine (Shenyang Kejing Auto-instrument Co., Ltd.)
cmp_process.slurry_delivery: BT-300EA digital peristaltic pump (Chongqing Jieheng Peristaltic Pump Co., Ltd.)
cmp_process.post_cmp_cleaning: Ultrasonically washed with DIW and absolute ethanol for 10 min

characterization_techniques.purpose: Measure slurry wettability on quartz glass
Analyze elemental composition and valence states

mechanism_summary.role_of_KOL: Acts as surfactant, reduces surface tension, creates stable suspension. Hydrolyzes to produce OH⁻, making the system alkaline (pH ~10). Alkaline environment reacts with SiO₂ to form silicate insoluble substances (softened layer), enhancing chemical removal.
mechanism_summary.role_of_CeO2: Ce⁴⁺ can reduce to Ce³⁺. Ce³⁺ reacts with Si-O bonds on the quartz surface, weakening them and forming Ce-O-Si bonds, which are removed under mechanical stress.
mechanism_summary.role_of_MoS2: Acts as a solid lubricant due to its layered structure and weak van der Waals forces between layers. Positioned between abrasive, pad, and substrate, it reduces friction and prevents excessive mechanical damage (scratches, pits) caused by hard/irregular CeO₂ particles. Enhances abrasive fluidity and wettability. Does not participate in chemical reactions (confirmed by XPS).
mechanism_summary.synergistic_effect: Combination of KOL-induced chemical softening, CeO₂ chemical reactivity (Ce³⁺), and MoS₂ lubrication leads to higher MRR and lower Ra compared to traditional CeO₂ slurry. MoS₂ mitigates mechanical damage while KOL/CeO₂ enhance chemical removal.

samples.experiment_context: Baseline CMP slurry with CeO₂ abrasive and NaOH for pH adjustment.

contact_angle_on_quartz.notes: Lower than S1 based on Fig 4, exact value not specified but visually ~30-35 degrees (lowest). Text states best wettability for 0.3 wt% MoS2.

ftir_analysis_after_cmp_on_quartz.notes: Shifts indicate interaction, likely Ce-O-Si bond formation.

samples.experiment_context: Data from Fig. 2 showing effect of pH (range ~2-10) on MRR for 0.1 wt% Sodiff Ceria, 0.25 wt% DL-aspartic acid, 31.0 kPa, 100 rpm turntable. Precise values require graph analysis.

characterization.abrasive_purity: Minimum 90% total rare earth oxides (minimum 60% CeO2), trace Fe2O3

SiO2.value: Trend: Suppressed below pH 3, increases pH 3-5, stable/slight decrease above pH 5. Value at pH 5 is 64.6 nm/min (from Table 1).

Si3N4.value: Trend: Suppressed below pH 5, increases significantly above pH 5. Value at pH 5 is 0.9 nm/min (from Table 1).

cmp_performance.selectivity: Trend: Very high (order of 100) in pH 4-5 range, low otherwise.

cmp_performance.polished_material_nitride: Low pressure chemical vapor deposition silicon nitride wafer (SemiWafer Inc., Taiwan)

samples.experiment_context: Data from Fig. 3 showing effect of DL-aspartic acid concentration (range ~0-0.5 wt%) on MRR for 0.1 wt% Sodiff Ceria at pH 5, 31.0 kPa, 100 rpm turntable. Precise values require graph analysis.

characterization.abrasive_purity: Minimum 90% total rare earth oxides (minimum 60% CeO2), trace Fe2O3

SiO2.value: Trend: Decreases rapidly up to 0.25 wt% additive, slight decrease thereafter. Value at 0 wt% is 115 nm/min (Table 2). Value at 0.25 wt% is 64.6 nm/min (Table 1). Value at 1 wt% is 39 nm/min (Table 2).

Si3N4.value: Trend: Decreases with additive, completely suppressed at/above 0.25 wt%. Value at 0 wt% is 25 nm/min (Table 2). Value at 0.25 wt% is 0.9 nm/min (Table 1). Value at 1 wt% is <1 nm/min (Table 2).

cmp_performance.selectivity: Trend: Increases significantly with additive, highest at 0.25 wt% and above.

cmp_performance.polished_material_nitride: Low pressure chemical vapor deposition silicon nitride wafer (SemiWafer Inc., Taiwan)

samples.experiment_context: Data from Figs. 4 & 5 showing effect of Ceria concentration (range 0.1-2 wt%) and DL-aspartic acid (0, 0.1, 0.15, 0.25 wt%) on MRR at pH 5, 31.0 kPa, 100 rpm turntable. Precise values require graph analysis.

characterization.abrasive_purity: Minimum 90% total rare earth oxides (minimum 60% CeO2), trace Fe2O3

SiO2.value: Trend: Increases with Ceria concentration for all additive levels. Suppressed by additive compared to no additive. Values for 0.1 wt% Ceria: 115 (0% add), ~80 (0.1% add), ~70 (0.15% add), 64.6 (0.25% add). Values for 2 wt% Ceria: 435 (0% add), ~300 (0.1% add), ~250 (0.15% add), ~200 (0.25% add).

Si3N4.value: Trend: Increases with Ceria concentration without additive. Suppressed by additive. At 0.1 wt% additive, moderate suppression. At 0.15 wt% additive, suppressed at low Ceria conc, significant at >=1.5 wt%. At 0.25 wt% additive, completely suppressed for all Ceria conc. Values for 0.1 wt% Ceria: 25 (0% add), ~10 (0.1% add), <1 (0.15% add), 0.9 (0.25% add). Values for 2 wt% Ceria: ~60 (0% add), ~30 (0.1% add), ~15 (0.15% add), <1 (0.25% add).

cmp_performance.selectivity: Trend: Generally decreases with increasing Ceria concentration (except at 0.25 wt% additive where Si3N4 is suppressed). Highest selectivity at 0.25 wt% additive.

characterization.particle_morphology: Regular round shapes, independent particles (SEM - TESCAN MIRA3)

characterization.IR_Spectra: Shows -OH peak, less change after polishing compared to acid version (VERTEX 70, Bruker)

samples.experiment_context: CMP of Fused Silica using novel acid SiO₂ slurry.

additives.name: Phenol
additives.role: Provides phenolic hydroxyl (-OH) for high MRR

characterization.particle_morphology: Regular round shapes, independent particles (SEM - TESCAN MIRA3)
characterization.TGA: Mass decreases gradually, significant decomposition 120-260°C. Higher decrease rate for new vs used abrasives (STA-449 F3)
characterization.IR_Spectra: Shows phenolic -OH peak, peak weakens significantly after 6h polishing (VERTEX 70, Bruker)
characterization.XPS_C1s: Shows C-C, O-C=O, π-π* satellite peaks (phenol). Intensities weaken after 6h polishing (PHI Quantera II, Ulvac-Phi Inc.)
characterization.NMR_Spectra: Shows shifts related to hydroxyl, aromatic/unsaturated structures (phenol). Changes after 6h polishing indicate product formation (Avance III 400, Bruker)

cmp_performance.surface_defects: Ultralow roughness, no obvious damage, uncontaminated surface

samples.mechanism_notes: Phenolic hydroxyl (-OH) plays a critical role in high MRR by activating Si-O bond breaking. Reaction: ≡Si-O-Si≡ + -OH → ≡Si-O- + ≡Si-OH. Reaction is thermally activated up to 90°C.

title: Ceria concentration effect on chemical mechanical polishing of optical glass

samples.experiment_context: Optical glass CMP using commercial ceria slurry at 1 wt% concentration.

slurry_preparation.abrasive_source: Shanghai Gona Powder Technology Co. Ltd.
slurry_preparation.preparation_details: Abrasives dispersed and treated by ultrasound for 10 min.

particle_size_distribution.details: Most particles around 80 nm, some 40 nm exist (Fig. 3).

surface_ce_valence_state.description: High absorption peaks for both Ce³⁺ and Ce⁴⁺ observed (Fig. 5).

post_cmp_surface_roughness_rms.details: Approximated midpoint of range 4.7-5.0 Å mentioned for 0.25-1 wt% slurries.

samples.experiment_context: Optical glass CMP using commercial ceria slurry at 0.5 wt% concentration.

slurry_preparation.abrasive_source: Shanghai Gona Powder Technology Co. Ltd.
slurry_preparation.preparation_details: Abrasives dispersed and treated by ultrasound for 10 min.

particle_size_distribution.details: Most particles around 80 nm, some 40 nm exist (Fig. 3).

surface_ce_valence_state.description: Ratio of Ce³⁺ to Ce⁴⁺ increased compared to 1 wt% (Fig. 5).

post_cmp_surface_roughness_rms.details: Approximated midpoint of range 4.7-5.0 Å mentioned for 0.25-1 wt% slurries.

samples.experiment_context: Optical glass CMP using commercial ceria slurry at 0.25 wt% concentration.

slurry_preparation.abrasive_source: Shanghai Gona Powder Technology Co. Ltd.
slurry_preparation.preparation_details: Abrasives dispersed and treated by ultrasound for 10 min.

particle_size_distribution.details: Most particles around 80 nm, some 40 nm exist (Fig. 3).

surface_ce_valence_state.description: Almost no maximum absorption for Ce⁴⁺ ions, while Ce³⁺ absorption peak remained high (Fig. 5).

theoretical_analysis.mechanism_notes: Increased MRR at lower concentration attributed to: 1) Better abrasive dispersion/uniformity leading to higher proportion of functioning particles. 2) Quantum effect: Lower concentration facilitates Ce⁴⁺ -> Ce³⁺ reduction on abrasive surface (promoted by ultrasound and potentially impurities), forming a beneficial Ce(OH)₃ hydration layer.

title: Chemical-mechanical polishing performance of core-shell structured polystyrene@ceria/nanodiamond ternary abrasives on sapphire wafer

substrate_information.supplier: Sichuan Xintong New Material Co., Ltd.

samples.experiment_context: Core-shell composite abrasive with Polystyrene (PS) core and Ceria (CeO2) shell, synthesized using 0.0115 mol L⁻¹ Ce(NO3)3·6H2O.

initiator_concentration.in_volume: 210 mL total (10 mL styrene + 200 mL water)

washing.method: Centrifuged with DI water and anhydrous alcohol

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical core-shell particles (~500 nm diameter) with grainy CeO2 shell (~10 nm crystallites). Shell thickness ~50 nm.
characterization.ftir_analysis_notes: Shows typical PS bands and Ce-O stretching vibration band (425-523 cm⁻¹).

eds_analysis.notes: Ce:O ratio ~1:2.69, close to CeO2. C% not reliable due to PS core.

samples.experiment_context: Core-shell composite abrasive with Polystyrene (PS) core and Detonation Nanodiamond (DND) shell, synthesized using 0.75 g L⁻¹ DND.

initiator_concentration.in_volume: 210 mL total (10 mL styrene + 200 mL water)

synthesis_shell_coating.precursor_treatment: Ground, deagglomerated, modified with CTAB (2 x 10⁻³ mol L⁻¹)

precursor_concentration.notes: Added as a 5 g L⁻¹ suspension

washing.method: Centrifuged with DI water and anhydrous alcohol

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical core-shell particles (~500 nm diameter) with rougher DND shell composed of ~5 nm crystallites. Shell thickness ~50 nm.
characterization.ftir_analysis_notes: Shows typical PS bands, intensified O-H, C=O, and carboxylate bands.

eds_analysis.notes: O likely from functional groups or adsorbed CTAB.

samples.experiment_context: Core-shell composite abrasive with Polystyrene (PS) core and a mixed Ceria (CeO2) / Detonation Nanodiamond (DND) shell.

initiator_concentration.in_volume: 210 mL total (10 mL styrene + 200 mL water)

synthesis_shell_coating.method: Sequential deposition: Chemical precipitation (CeO2) followed by Electrostatic self-assembly (DND)
synthesis_shell_coating.precursor_treatment_dnd: Ground, deagglomerated, modified with CTAB (2 x 10⁻³ mol L⁻¹)

ph_during_reaction.notes: Adjusted after CeO2 deposition, before DND addition

washing.method: Centrifuged with DI water and anhydrous alcohol

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical core-shell particles (~500 nm diameter). Uniform CeO2 layer (~10nm crystallites) coated first, then unevenly attached small DND clusters (~5nm crystallites). Rougher surface than PS@CeO2. Shell thickness ~50 nm.
characterization.ftir_analysis_notes: Shows typical PS bands, Ce-O stretching, intensified O-H, C=O, and carboxylate bands.

eds_analysis.notes: O% higher than PS@CeO2, suggests more oxygen-containing groups.

polishing_mechanism_notes.xps_detritus_analysis: Detected C-C (PS), C-C (DND), C-O, C=O/C-OH, CeO2, Al2O3, AlOOH, Al(OH)3, CeAlxOy, Ce3+, Ce4+.
polishing_mechanism_notes.synergistic_effect: Elastic PS core increases contact area/duration. Dense CeO2/DND shell provides chemical (CeO2) and mechanical (DND) polishing.

mechanism_notes: Solid-state chemical reaction occurs during polishing (Sec 3.3)
Reaction between sapphire surface (Al₂O₃ -> AlOOH) and SiO₂ to form Al₂SiO₅ (Eq 2, 3)
Reaction between CeO₂, SiO₂, and Al₂O₃ to form Al₄SiCeO₃ (Eq 4)
XPS analysis confirms presence of Al₂SiO₅ and Al₄SiCeO₃ post-polishing (Fig 6, Tables 3-5)

title: Development of carbon sphere/ceria (CS/CeO₂) heterostructured particles and their applications to functional abrasives toward photochemical mechanical polishing

samples.experiment_context: Undoped Carbon Sphere/Ceria (CS/CeO₂) heterostructured particles used as abrasive in conventional Chemical Mechanical Polishing (CMP). Synthesized via hydrothermal method for CS followed by in-situ chemical precipitation for CeO2 coating.

particle_size_distribution.notes: Polydispersed. SEM shows modes around 70-80 nm, 140-150 nm, 250-260 nm (Fig. 4a).

surface_ce3_percent_xps.notes: Calculated from integrated peak areas in Ce 3d spectrum (Fig. 7b, Table 1).

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical polydispersed core-shell particles with rough appearances (Fig. 4c)

samples.experiment_context: Undoped Carbon Sphere/Ceria (CS/CeO₂) heterostructured particles used as abrasive in Photochemical Mechanical Polishing (PCMP) with UV irradiation.

slurry_preparation.preparation_method: Ultrasonic dispersion, followed by UV irradiation (10 min)

particle_size_distribution.notes: Polydispersed. SEM shows modes around 70-80 nm, 140-150 nm, 250-260 nm (Fig. 4a).

surface_ce3_percent_xps.notes: Calculated from integrated peak areas in Ce 3d spectrum (Fig. 7b, Table 1).

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical polydispersed core-shell particles with rough appearances (Fig. 4c)

samples.experiment_context: Yttrium-doped Carbon Sphere/Ceria (CS/CeYO₂) heterostructured particles (Y/(Ce+Y) = 0.1) used as abrasive in Photochemical Mechanical Polishing (PCMP) with UV irradiation.

slurry_preparation.preparation_method: Ultrasonic dispersion, followed by UV irradiation (10 min)

particle_size_distribution.notes: Assumed similar to undoped CS. Polydispersed. SEM shows modes around 70-80 nm, 140-150 nm, 250-260 nm (Fig. 4a).

surface_functional_groups.notes: FTIR not shown for doped sample.

elemental_composition.measurement_method_used: Implied by synthesis, XPS not shown for doped sample.

characterization.particle_morphology: Spherical polydispersed core-shell particles with rough appearances (Fig. 4e)

xrd_peaks.notes: No separate Y2O3 peaks detected, slight shift due to doping.

F2g_mode.notes: Slightly shifted to lower wavenumber vs undoped
